question:
A company has migrated several applications to AWS in the past 3 months. The company wants to know the breakdown of costs for each of these applications. The company wants to receive a regular report that includes this information.

Which solution will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?

options.A: Use AWS Budgets to download data for the past 3 months into a .csv file. Look up the desired information.
options.B: Load AWS Cost and Usage Reports into an Amazon RDS DB instance. Run SQL queries to get the desired information.
options.C: Tag all the AWS resources with a key for cost and a value of the application's name. Activate cost allocation tags. Use Cost Explorer to get the desired information.
options.D: Tag all the AWS resources with a key for cost and a value of the application's name. Use the AWS Billing and Cost Management console to download bills for the past 3 months. Look up the desired information.

explanation: Cost allocation tags with Cost Explorer provide cost breakdown by application with built-in reporting capabilities. This is the most cost-effective approach without requiring additional infrastructure like RDS.
